Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS RUBBISH!!! STAY AWAYYYY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hameed h
Reviews.Content: i went to barcelona with 3 friends, and chose to stay here as the reviews were ok and it was cheap. When we got there and were shown to our room, all four of us ( me and my 3 friends) were shocked at the condition of the place. The shower had dead bugs in and my bed even had a dead cockroach !!!!....Asked for new sheets and explained it wasnt acceptable, the reply given was "oh god"...the area in which it is situated is full of PROSTITUTES AND DRUG DEALERS...every night police were outside the hotel. When we would go to the front desk to ask for assistance or help on two separate occasions the receptionist WAS HIGH AND STRUGGLING TO EVEN COMMUNICATE...even saw other people staying there complaining of money being stolen from rooms and also debit/credit cards...thank god we all took our personal belongings with us....there were also holes in the walls the air con didn't work and the place generally smelt like urine...also promised a BUFFET BREAKFAST but all that was available was bread and processed cheese!!...this place is ridiculous and after the first night moved to another hotel about 5 minutes down the road which was BEAUTIFULLLL!!!!!...and only cost us 180euros between 4!...so about 45 pounds a night!!...it was like heaven compared to the other place!!!!!!....my advice STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bang in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: annarella1978
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews on this hotel, I was weary of what we were walking into. But I am pleased to report that, whilst the rooms are very basic, the location is unbeatable and I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Staff were helpful, friendly and polite. And they get an extra mark for not making fun of my attempts to speak Spanish! ;) Basic, no-frills is the mantra here, do not expect anything fancy, but if what you are after is a roof over your head in a great spot from where you can explore Barcelona, then book this hotel. You are paying for the location here - and it is totally worth it! - forget about grand rooms or scrumptious breakfasts - ours was barely passable, but there are so many cafes around the hotel if you want a more palatable alternative.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience -- stay away!”
Reviews.Author: cjmlondon8
Reviews.Content: Overall, a horrible experience. Reception nearly refused to let us check in late after our plane was delayed, the shower didn't work and the beds were very uncomfortable, and the area is quite dodgy at night. Then, we had some cash stolen from the room. When we reported it, they first said that there was absolutely nothing they could do (we were required to leave the key at reception when out, so they had our key at the time, not to mention a master key). Then, when I pressed them, they totally changed their story and said that it was an ongoing problem, and that there had been several other thefts in the past few days. AND YOU DIDN"T BOTHER TO WARN US???!! totally unacceptable. I have backpacked all over, and have stayed in plenty of very cheap hotels and often dodgy hotels, and this is the first negative review I've ever written, because the service and the attitude of the management was so outrageous. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing works!”
Reviews.Author: NadiaMilano_Italia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Rambla de Catalunya, in a very busy spot because a lot of nightlife takes place nearby. When we arrived the concierge was very fiendly and managed to give us good information... Once in the room nightmare started: the bed was unbearable with a matress no-one could have slept in, the phone didn't work, the tv neither!!! The guy from the reception did not know how to solve the problems... The worst was that the room faced directly over the street and we could noy close an eye until 5 am. We decided to leave immediately!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff - pity about the room”
Reviews.Author: Andymiller_brs
Reviews.Content: The Adagio was the first night of our honeymoon and from the photos looked a lovely little hotel. We weren't wrong when we arrived, that is until we got up to our room. It was small, which I can cope with but like an oven as there appeared to be no air conditioning or any other way of cooling it down. Well I opened the window and the door that went into a little area within the building. Sadly there was a dank stench almost sewage like, but don't think it was, and one little airconditioning unit that must of been for another hotel or room within ours. Bathroom was clean, as was the room although there was a cigarette burn on the beds oversheet. The people on reception couldn't be more helpful, recommending places to eat, phoning the reccomendations to see if we needed to book, helped us get online with their wi-fi and even sourced us a taxi on the morning. The room really let the rest of the hotel down but am sure that there were other rooms that were a lot nicer. Perhaps it was our own fault for not asking to move, however I felt for one night it wouldn't make a difference. The location is handy for the Gothic area and La Rambla. Very worth looking at if staying for a short break and need somewhere just to get your head down.

Reviews.Title: “NIghtmare hotel”
Reviews.Author: Illinoisresident
Reviews.Content: The receptionist are unhelpful and on the phone chatting all the time, cannot connect to them from room. Woke up at 3 AM because of a yelling guy outside trying to call someone in the nearby apartment. Very noisy area, no quiet time. Took few hours before aircon (if there really is) worked. Bathroom is tiny, my stuff fell on the floor, no place to put toiletries. Room has some odor, beddings ancient. Worst part, elevator broke down, imagine pulling our luggages up and down the stairs. Hallways were literally narrow. Only good thing is the breakfast and short distance to shopping places and Cathedral de Barcelona. Still, you can find a better motel elsewhere. Will never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ClareLancs
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel! It`s in the best location just off Las Ramblas. Everything is on your doorstep. The hotel itself is basic but it`s a bonus that it has air conditioning (definately needed in the summer months). The reception staff are wonderful, so friendly and helpful, 10/10! I would certainly go back to the Adagio and i would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hostel, not hotel”
Reviews.Author: daliman
Reviews.Content: In a word 'terrible'. How anyone can say this hotel is above one star is beyond me. I wouldn't tell anyone to stay here. As others have said, location is great, right in the heart of the Gothic District but there are plenty of hotles to stay in in this area or close to it. However, that also has it's drawbacks as people party all night (until about 4am) and there is pub and a nightclub virtually within meters of the hotel (and it's not sound proof). Some of our problems - bed very uncomfortable. Room tiny. Lino floor which looked unclean. Hole in the bathroom door. Bath you could only sqaut in (half normal size). Breakfast is rubbish - watery coffee, fake juice, a few bread rolls and some salami slices. Walls paper thin - you could hear outside and the next rooms clearly - even people walking in the hallway. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: theharrogatelady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four years ago and admit that it could do with a makeover!! The rooms are very basic and a little tatty now with tatty laminate flooring and basic furniture but our two rooms were clean, as were the bathrooms. Everyone on the desk were helpful except for one guy in the afternoon who was a bit on the grumpy side to say the least. He could not find the key we had handed in and with a big que forming he got stroppy and said it was our problem to sort out not his! He then looked again after we wrote the room number down and he found the key. He apologised but had shown dreadful customer service. However on the other hand, on arriving I could not genuinly remember if I had paid upfront or pay on arrival. The chap very pleasantly explained that he thought it would be on arrival and suggested i rang on the hotel phone to England to confirm that i needed to pay on arrival. He was right and i paid 200 Euro in total for two rooms for two nights. During our stay the staff searched out restaurants for me on the internet and suggested discounted ways to buy Tourist Bus tickets and Camp Nou tickets. I think that 200 Euro for 4 people for 2 nights is very reasonable for the centre of Barcelona especially during school holidays. I am certain that you get much better hotels even in that location but I wanted an easy start to the holiday by knowing were i was going with an easy walk from the Airport bus. I emailed ahead of our stay saying we were repeat guests and could we have two nice rooms at the front. They replied and duly arranged! The shilling bar next door is a smart bar/Tapas and welcomes families and there is also a fantastic genuine Tapas bar with an amazing selection of Tapas displayed approx 5 doors up from this hotel. Cullertas restaurant (the oldest in Barcelona) is within metres and so is La Fonda another fabulous place we ate at. I reccomend the place if you are happy with basic accommodation in an excellent location. I enjoy 5* beach holiday accommodation but can equally recognise the appeal of this basic 1* style place! You get what you pay for!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the pitts”
Reviews.Author: competent_one
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel, a motel probably does better! Location is excellent, everything else, even 1 star is too generous! First night, they put us in a room with balcony door that did not close/latch and the heater was broken! In the middle of December! Second night, they put us in a room so dirty, we were afraid to step inside! There was not a working phone in either room! The elevator broke down as we were moving from one room to another! No one cared!!!!!!!!!! The desk manager told everyone what they wanted to hear, did nothing, and laughed behind people's backs... This was the dirtiest, coldest, ugliest place we've ever stayed in! Never again! Stay at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “bad, bad, bad -- avoid at all costs! so not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cjmlondon8
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel during our three days in Barcelona, and it was a big, big mistake. During the day, the surrounding area is fine and pleasant but at night there are prostitutes and drug dealers all around, with vomit on every corner. We arrived late and even though we thought the hotel didn't look particularly secure (pretty flimsy locks on the room doors and again, rough part of town) we decided to stay. Bad mistake. When we arrived we were warned about thieves on the streets, told that the neighborhood was known for pickpockets, and told not to carry around any unnecessary cash or IDs, etc. We followed this advice and even though we never had much cash, we did leave some tucked away in the bags in the room. Our last night there, we returned to find the money stolen, around $80. That in and of itself would not have been the hotels fault, but to complicate matters the hotel required us to leave the key at the front desk when we were out. So it could have been someone from the hotel. Or it just as easily could have been someone from the street who walked in, since they never check ID when you ask for the key and I never saw the same person at the front desk -- i.e., I walked up and told him/her my room number and without any way of verifying that it was me they gave me the key. The attendant immediately started launching into an explanation about how he couldn't believe this had happened again, people had been losing money from their room for a week and they thought that someone posing as a guest was picking locks and then immediately changed his story when I got mad because THEY KNEW THAT ROOMS WERE BEING BROKEN INTO AND NO ONE HAD WARNED US. They didn't say a thing. He then told us we must immediately (it was midnight) go to the police station and report it, couldn't wait until the morning, and the hotel insurance would cover the theft if we had a police report. So we went, put my Spanish skills to the test filing the report, and returned at 2:30 in the morning with the report. Next morning, a new guy told me that there was no way the hotel insurance could cover an amount so small and that the police report wasn't good for anything. When I asked about a partial refund -- since they did have the key in their possession when the money was taken -- he said there was no way, refused to call the manager, and said they weren't going to do anything else to warn other guests. That was a lot of words to say: the hotel is unsafe, the hotel management didn't tell guests that they knew a thief was robbing rooms, they changed their story and lied to my face when they realized they had just incriminated themselves, and sent me to the police station in the middle of the night for nothing. Worst hotel I've ever stayed at and I've traveled to some very sketchy and low-budget hotels all over Latin America and Europe. I'm usually very easy-going, don't have high expectations at all, and if the manager had come up to me and said I'm so sorry, here is a 25% refund and we will alert other guests until we get this figured out, I would have left pacified. As it was, I left livid. DON"T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you want”
Reviews.Author: gerrymg
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in various hotels around The Ramblas we expected a good quality of hotel and service . How wrong could we have been . We arrived to find the young guy on reception had very little grasp of english , maybe we should make an effort to speak spanish, however he tried very hard to help and we got our keys to hell , sorry our room. We entered to find the fourth floor room infested with ants . Not quite the start we wanted . We spoke to reception and were told no other rooms were available . Next visit supermarket to get ant killer . We finally got the ants under control . After Speaking to another chap at reception who was very unhelpful , we were told that we would get a room when one became available. He seemed horrified that there were ants in the room. Anyway it took three days before we got a change of room . All attempts to speak to the manager fell on deaf ears . When we finally moved rooms to the first floor after our persistance , we found the walls to the rooms are paper thin . Noisey screaming neighbours caused a bit of friction as reception didnt want to know . The TV didnt work , not a great problem when on holiday , but none the less it is part of the deal .As is air conditioning , which was not working on the fourth floor and intermitantly on the first . All in all a very poor run hotel . If you want a good place to stay dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A god time despite the noise”
Reviews.Author: JollitaMcJolly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely ideal for a stay in the very heart of Barcelona - the location is right in the thick of the atmospheric Gothic Quater. The room was very basic but clean. Take a bath plug for the bath. Our room was situated round the back with a view out into a ventilation shaft which was fine as we were only using it to sleep and wash in as a base for a couple of days, and the price reflected this. However, the other guests were extremely noisy and drunk and this included a group of men coming in and shouting over each other at 5am one morning - this went on for over an hour and was impossible to sleep through. The first night someone also tried our door handle in the middle of the night, so make sure you lock it. The breakfast was basic but adequate to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locataion, didn't expect better”
Reviews.Author: brenorg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located next to the ramblas, a minute walk and you're there. Metro station is about 3 minutes walk, just right in the centre of the Ramblas. Nearest metro is Liceu. Upon arrival we were greeted by the receptionist which was an Argentinian young man, very helpfull and excellent in his job. He explained us in detail everything we asked him. The room is small with a small wardrobe and an ensuite bathroom, but both room and bathroom were clean and everything was fine. From my room I could connect to a nearby wi-fi since the hotel wi-fi is only accessible in the reception area, it is free and there are also plugs where you can plug your laptop. Breakfast was good for a 2 star hotel, with fresh bread, cheese, cold cuts, cereals, jams ecc. There is also a machine which serves hot drinks, so the product is consistent. The only problem is that the area can be noisy at night and you can expect it since it is in a busy area and in front of it there is a pub, however I cannot complain about not sleeping all night long. Should it have been a luxury hotel, such things are unaccaptable since one expects double glazing closures. I recommend Hotel Adagio for all those looking for a good location, with good price and good service. I wouldn't bother to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “all you could expect from a 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: walesy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic with La Ramblas just a stride away, and also the harbour is only a 15 minute walk. Upon arrival our room was ready and check-in was very quick and easy. My partner speaks little Spanish and me even less so the hotel receptionist was very accommodating and spoke English well, however I would always try to speak the language of the country I am visiting out of respect and courtesy. When we got into our room it was clean and tidy with a TV (all Spanish cannels), wardrobe, and phone. The bathroom was also clean and tidy with a shower bath. What you have to remember is that this is only a 2* hotel, so if you are expecting a coffee maker and mini bar you are in the wrong hotel class. The walls are paper thin and you will hear everything what goes on in the next room (shall we say the couple next door had a very good night whilst we were there). Then we got woke up by the cleaners every morning at 6:30 as they started their round. This may sound bad but once people had settled in for the night the hotel itself is quite quiet, the latest night we had was on New Years Eve which was around 01:30, which can be expected at New Years Eve. Breakfast was provided with coffee and juice, cereal and cold meats and cheese with bread rolls, everything what you expect really from a continental breakfast. There are some good bars and restaurants very near by with a large square (large fountain in the middle) just across the road down the side of an Irish pub (My Bar), the glacier bar is very nice and reasonable for drinks, whilst Rossini is very good food and even better service (you will pay around 50 euro’s for a 3 course meal including drinks between 2 persons). The Adagio Hotel itself is ideal for a short break or long weekend but I would not like to stay much longer, however I am trying to be impartial, and would say that it the thinness of the walls which let this hotel down (but his can not be helped as the building itself is quite old).

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: FLUGEN
Reviews.Content: Me & my partner stayed at this hotel for one night in December. We checked in at around 1pm to a small but comfortable room on the 2nd floor looking on to a side street. The only problem we encountered was the noise coming from this side street in the early hours of the morning. But being there only for 1 night was'nt really a problem. If we were going to stay for more nights we would have asked to change the room, to be given an inner one. The hotel is incredibly near all the major sites in the Gotic Quarter, just a few meters from Las Ramblas, the port and Plaza Catalunya. Moreover we felt quite safe at night because the streets around the hotel are always full of poeple. However just be careful as in any major city! The hotel staff was helpful and eager to help. They even kept our 2 small luggages on the day we checked-out and picked them at around 6pm! The breakast offered, although small, was sufficient to get us going for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: magicwhelk
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the Hotel Adagio after walking past it on the street. It's a good location in the old part of Barcelona near lots of shops and restaurants. I had a room on the top floor which was quiet. The room was clean. There was free wi-fi in the hotel lobby and the breakfast, although limited in choice was sufficient. In conclusion, basic but good value with nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Very noise hotel”
Reviews.Author: carol5580
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in the right city centre of barcelona, but it's very noise as the room is exterior, the door of the balcony didn't close properly and the hotel is a bit old so you can listen to the water running into the pipes... They have wifi for free but the conexion in the room was slow and he conected to the wifi of the bar in front of the hotel... Breakfast ok.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: aussie987
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5pm. Reception staff very rude and unhelpful. Gave key to room which was a very small twin (we booked a double) when asked to be changed was told rudely hard luck thats all we have. The Hotels (if you can call it that) had the air con turned off and refused to put back on. The picture of this hotel lie, the breakfast room is part of the reception area, the beds were hard and we had a fine welcome by the animals that also wanted to share the room with us. Needless to say we found a much nicer hotel and didnt stay here. Spend more money and stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"pets" in the room...”
Reviews.Author: Jens040
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, but the hotel itself was mediocre. Ants and a cockroach in our room... Breakfast was good though :).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great location”
Reviews.Author: Pedro28Portugal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, clean, the staff is friendly and it has a great location (neer Ramblas). The room temperature was a little high. Good breakfast. Recomend it for a short period.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adagio is Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Brendermann
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Adagio and the night manager made rude and offensive comments to both of us about being Americans and told us to "get out" of the hotel after we had asked him to stop it. Although the location is very good, we checked out immediately and went to a nearby hostel with wonderful management where we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: frannyr01
Reviews.Content: 5 mature females we spent 5 nights in Adagio hotel it is exactly as described basic but great value. spotless clean bed linen and towels changed every day when air conditioning was requested it was put on straight away.Breakfast was simple but adiquate ( hot drinks could have been hotter, Reception staff were so friendly and helpful and breakfast lady very pleasant and always cleaning something. great location for sightseeing some weird people hanging around but we never felt threatened by them. room to front was noisy all night but we new this before going but it was a good size tripple room so we didn`t ask for a change we would recomend it to anybody but we will take ear plugs next time

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: arabella22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was is a great location to all things touristy. Very easy to find, right btw the KFC and McDonalds. Hotel staff was helpful and spoke English. I loved the FREE internet access (9am – midnight). Very clean rooms and a nice bathroom. Noise is an issue but just bring some earplugs and you will be fine. BFK is rolls, ham, cheese, cereal, coffee/OJ. The one thing that I did not like was cigarette smoke from the other room filtered into my room and there was no air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “great budget option cleann and central location!!!”
Reviews.Author: treadi2001
Reviews.Content: clean great location near everywhere, cheap as chips!!! recommend it for cheap option!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dbhBristol_England
Reviews.Content: First class service, reception were polite and very helpful. Rooms were clean and adequate for a business trip. Hotel position is excellent for exploring Las Ramblas area with supurb bars and restaurants nearby. You won't beat this hotel at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer87
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent location, situated just of the Ramblas. Ideal as its near lots of shops, bars and cafes [Mc Donalds, KFC, Starbucks, traditional Spanish shops too]. 2 minutes from the nearest metro station. 20 minutes from Aerobus stop. 5 minutes from Cathedral. 5 minutes from Supermarket. Staff/Service: The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. They helped find tourist destinations on our map, offered to look after our key, offered a safe free of charge, stored our bags safely after check out, on service all evening. Breakfast: Menu- Couissant, jams, bread rolls, meat and cheese, frosted flake cereal, juice, coffee machine [serving a very nice hot chocolate]. Only downside was that there were only about 8 tables so on the first morning we went back to our room for 10 minutes to wait for a table. Rooms: Simple and basic. Comfy beds and decent bathroom. Great hair dryer and a pressure shower, which is so good at the end of the day. No plug though unfortunately for a bath! The rooms were cleaned everyday, once whilst we were having our breakfast. However our soaps didnt get replaced. I visited this hotel with my boyfriend on our first trip away together and our first time to Barcelona, a young couple, we thought the location was excellent, however do not go to this hotel if you are looking for luxury, as you wont find it here. But if you are going to Barcelona as a tourist then by the end of the day of hard site seeing you will be so warn out you will be glad of a good shower and a comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “good location, surly staff”
Reviews.Author: KateCardiffWales
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in an excellent location but the rooms were VERY basic and the staff were quite unhelpful to be honest. I would stay on the same street again but not this hotel. They had a bizarre policy of making you leave your keys there at night which i was not happy about. Also although we booked a double they gave us a twin room. The location of our room was also not great as the doors werent soundproof at all and we were right by the top of the stairs to our floor and the lift entrance. It was ok but not really anything to write home about. Fab location though. If you want cheap and not cheerful then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and budget price”
Reviews.Author: rockstar3434
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Adagio has a good central location near Placa Jaume and walking distance to Placa Catalunya. A Metro stop is one block away. Plenty of restaurants nearby, though most cater to tourists. 15 minute walk to coast. I stayed in a single room that was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful. Only complaint is that it can be noisy at night from the streets below. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Darlo_man
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a beautiful city, full of character, verve, vibrancy, culture, history and for me, most importantly, the home of what is one of the wonders of this age and probably the most awesome building I have visited despite the fact it probably won't be finished in my lifetime, the Sagrada Familia - an anochronism if ever there was one but one an anochronism! If God were writing a trip advisor review of the Familia Sagrada he would extol its virtues and give it an excellent rating. But I am not God and I stayed in a far more down to earth establishment - the Hotel Adagio just off La Rambla. I was on a lone visit and the room was small despite having a good size double bed which at first seemed rather hardish but afforded good rest qualities. The room was simply decorated and the furniture was in keeping with the ambience - perfectly adequate for my short stay with a large wardrobe with plenty of shelf space. It would be unjust to judge the adequacy for a couple staying at the hotel because I booked a single room but the room I stayed in would have been rather too cramped for more than one - even if the couple were on exceptionally good terms! Other rooms might well have been bigger. The room had a veranda which looked out onto an extremely narrow street - one hopes that the person living opposite would not peer down from the balcony at the same time otherwise heads might bump - no not that bad but certainly 'intimate'! By the way, no sign of druggies or ladies of the night as mentioned in another review( not that I was looking for either!). The bathroom was small but very clean. The shower was fine - powerful and with temperature control easily achieved. Interestingly, the shower appeared to double as a bath which was adequate for a child until they understood the meaning of the term NSPCC. But then a family would not have been staying in this room. Bed linen, towels, room cleanliness were all of an exceptionally hight level and I really must commned the lovely ladies who kept the room spotless and were very civil and happy to smile. Well done Adagio! The reception staff were excellent - and I use the term advisedly. They were friendly, courteous, smart, helpful and all I encountered spoke excellent English. Very commendable indeed. They were happy to print out my priority Ryanair boarding pass for my return flight - free!! There was a continuous humming from the heating/ac system which took a while to get used to but I mention this only in passing. Walls seemed rather thin and conversation could be heard from adjoining rooms. Television had CNN and plenty of indigenous channels. Breakfast was typically continental - croissants, buns, cereal, jams, meats, cheese and a good selection of hot and cold drinks. It was rather more limited in variety than other hotels I have stayed in but a perfectly adequate start to the day and for the price paid I got this hotel at a bargain price and quite frankly, I'd be happy to stay again. It is central and immaculately clean with a friendly staff. f you sleep lightly then you might want to look elsewhere - the noise is not the fault of the hotel, just the result of its location. It's a 2 star tourist hotel so don't expect the Ritz but for someone like me on a tight budget I can recommend this hotel as an ideal base for Barcelona. It is certainly better than the previous hotel I stayed in in Barca which was 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: cn14
Reviews.Content: If one word can characterize this hotel, it must be location. The hotel is located right next to the busy Rambla boulevard in Barcelona. My father and I were going for a cruise starting from Barcelona, so I chose this hotel for its location, hoping that we will have some time for a concentrated city tour before we board the boat. And I was right. This hotel is conveniently located close to all major attractions on my visiting list. Before I arrived I was a bit worried after having read somewhere that this hotel is located in the red-light district. But what a wonderful lively area it was, full with activities, people, bars, restaurants. So my worry disappeared right away. The only problem was the street Ferran is mostly pedestrian and not open for traffic, that was what my taxi driver told me, who left me at the city hall square from where I have to drag my luggage to the hotel, about 3-5 minutes. But it was really not a problem. I booked a single room, clean, quiet, basic. The TV did not work. But I didn't come here to watch BBC anyway. The bathroom was perfect, no problem with leaking water or drainage. My father's room has a window facing a horrible looking well so he had the curtain down all the time. My room window is facing a small side street, very quiet. The breakfast was basic, toast, juice from the machine, and coffee. I read that there was free wifi internet available, and it turned out only the laptop computer in the lobby was connected. And there was only one so you have to queue. The staff at the lobby was efficient and spoke good English. I wouldn't mind to stay in the same hotel if ever I come back to Barcelona. It's basic, but I pay for what I get.

Reviews.Title: “Best 2 star hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: lolasanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the BEST street, in the BEST location in Barcelona. The reception people are always at 100% sold out and they told me that no less the 50 times a day they turn people away who just try and walk in, or book the day before. The rooms were clean, large for Europe, and have a little balcony that when you close the doors, it is sound proof. The beds are SUPER small, no joke folks, but for the price, you can’t beat it. I have stayed in all sorts of hotels, b&b’s and so forth, and even if I had a huge budget, I would stay at this hotel again. 2 stars is given only because there is no mini bar, or satellite TV… so what right? Location, location, location, clean fun rooms, a staff with humor and wit. A great place for the young at heart and ready to go woop it up in the Gothic quarter. This place was 10+. PS – Ramblas is for those who like Las Vegas. The gothic quarter is more for those like love New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Adagio”
Reviews.Author: kiwipharmacist
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a weeks holiday in Barcelona, Spain for our mid- year holiday. We arrived from Girona airport and took a shuttle bus to the bus station.After obtaining a map we were able to orient oursleves to the Las Ramblas. The hotel was very easy to find. It is situated near a McDonalds on the Lamblas. Unfortunately due to our travel agent ( GOING PLACES ) forgetting to book the hotel for us ( as we got a package) The hotel had no record of our stay. Even though we had receipts and confirmation of our OWN booking. The receptionist was very good to us........ Despite not being able to speak Spanish he gave us a single room with a single bed and I got the stretcher- Which i must add was comfortable anyway. -- What happened was a bit of a nuisance but I wasn't going to let it get to me on my first european trip. The hotel was very clean and facilites very good. I did not find it noisey. The room had a extra curtain cover to prevent the strong rays of the sun from coming in. In the morning we had a nice breakfast consisting of Cerals, breads, hot chocolate and juices. The staff were very friendly and helpful--- though one of the night receptionists did scare me as he looked like a relative of the mafia. The hotel has an excellent location and I would recommend it for any friends who are travelling as its a cost effective place. I would stay here again. Barcelona is my favourite european city and I would return any day

Reviews.Title: “Noisy But Nice”
Reviews.Author: MikePGloucester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Adagio after being dropped off by the taxi driver at the end of C Ferran as no vehicles are allowed at certain times. We then found we had to spend a night at a nearby Hotel due to a problem with our room. However, the remaining six days of our stay were OK. The room and its facilities were kept clean and although it was a little faded/battered it was comfortable enough. The soundproofing if it existed was ineffective but the only disturbance we experienced was from young English tourist's lack of consideration for others. Not something I can blame on the Hotel. The breakfasts were continental and more than adequate supervised by pleasant staff. The front desk staff were also helpful and generally cheerful. Overall, a pleasant experience I would recommend it for younger visitors who want to be in the centre of things. Given the excellence of the Barcelona transport system older visitors could perhaps find quieter accommodation further from the Barcelona centre.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cosy!”
Reviews.Author: Lyydia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Adagio last April and it was a pleasant experience. The location near Las Ramblas is perfect and the staff was very friendly, especially the breakfast lady. The breakfast itself was quite basic with bread, coffee, juice, and cereals but always fresh. Our room was tidy and comfortable. The price was also relatively modest. Perfect for those who want to see the beautiful city instead of spending time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position For Travelers On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: stansmith
Reviews.Content: I have given this hotel a mark of above average but this is pretty much for the location and cost. I have no complaints about the hotel, it was clean and was reasonably well decorated which is all you can ask for at a price of £80 for a twin room, and that is the massive plus point of this hotel. For £80 we got a clean hotel and room which is in perfect position a minutes walk from the Ramblas and a minutes walk from the heart of the Gothic Quarter. If you're in Barcelona and looking for a luxury hotel to pamper yourself in then this isn't for you, but if you are looking for a place on a budget which is a place to get a night's sleep and be in a great position then it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: SooB+C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's stay at the Adagio hotel and just wanted to say this was a great find in a great location. No, it wasn't luxurious or anything but provided good value accomodation in the heart of this busy area. All the staff (reception, cleaning staff, breakfast staff) were friendly and helpful. Rooms were basic but adequate, the double glazing helped tremdously on cutting down the noise. The area is noisy so don't expect a great night's sleep, but lets remember it is a city and the area is popular for bars and eating places. Ask about the safe (not in room) at reception, the secure boxes are in a secure room and can be used for 3 euro per day. The breakfast was a buffet which offered meats, cheese, bread rolls and cereal, a machine provided the coffee (which was a little disappointing) and also water and juice. All fine with us and kept us fed and watered easily up till lunch and sometimes till evening. The rooms have a balcony (ours looked out over a side street, I notice some reviews say this is a problem, we didnt find this at all and in fact it meant it was a slightly quieter room than being on the main street) In terms of area you are right by a metro line (great to hop on and off, especially with a ten trip pass), you are near to La Rambla (great for wandering, keep tight hold of your bag though), but for me the best thing was how close we were to the Gothic quarter and all the sights that brings All in all we had a great week in a busy bustling city (that got very hot while we were there). This hotel for me was a great find, cheap(ish), great location and provided a useful base for all our jaunts around this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: helenathome
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel we have ever stayed in. We booked a triple room through a UK-based hotel company, but were given a single-size room with 3 beds in that you could not walk around and, in order to open the window or watch TV you had to move one of them each time. To negotiate the toilet in the bathroom you had to squeeze past the wash basin. There was 'air conditioning' that came out of only part of the battered unit and was totally useless, and the bedding was dirty, plus, there were fire hazard ceiling tiles which would not be allowed in the UK. It was dark and unkempt and totoally unwelcoming. When we asked for another room, the reception guy just shrugged his shoulders and said to get another hotel which, with the help of our booking company, we did, but we had to sleep in this awful hotel overnight first, which was very hot and smelly. The breakfast consisted of a few tasteless and dry pastries, nothing hot at all, and was presided over by an equally unfriendly old woman, who didn't acknowledge us or smile once. Knowing that we were moving out, the hotel would not let us stay until we could check in later that afternoon- even though we had paid for 6 nights - as they said they had already given our room to someone else. No wonder then, that we were so pleased to see the back of the place and move to a 4-star hotel further up, in the much nicer Modernista area. We had chosen La Rambla as our base, due to having our son with us, and my current mobility problem, so it was an inconvenience to us to move hotels but, given the cirumstances, we had no choice, and we were able to see a lot of Gaudi's buildings close by. We have stayed in a lot of hotels and understand that this is only a 2-star, but the state of the hotel and unfriendliness makes it the worst. Our booking company said they were going to remove the Adagio from their list, which is very wise. It might be OK for single, young packpackers, but for a family it is hopelessly inadequate. On a general point about Barcelona: In high summer, it is very busy, noisy and stinks, due to the poor drainage. Plus, the service is generally very slow. However, we did not experience any of the pickpockets we had read about, thankfully. Tip: Don't waste your money on the boat trips, the scenery isn't exactly stunning and the glass bottom aspect only works when it's tied up in the harbour beforehand. DO go on a city tour on a bus turistic and get a feel for what Barca has to offer, then you can return. And, finally, make an early start, because every attraction gets packed by midday, especially the tram and funicular railway up to the Tibidabo mountian (which has a great theme park at the top, next to a magnificent church with giant statue of Christ).

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: hmlaw88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Adagio in Mid JUN 2006. Location and the hotel qualify is great. Staff is very friendly and everything is within walking distance. Breakfast is good. The drawback is the wireless internet is not working that well. But overall, i will be delighted to stay in this hotel when return to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You get what you see! On the Plus + : 1. Its Very Clean 2. Excellent location - your slap bang in the centre of everything and this is what your paying for. 3. Nice bathroom with good warm shower 4. Free Internet 5. Excellent Staff, friendly, helpful, you feel safe - they don't let anybody in the hotel and the doorway is always manned by the receptionist. 6. Don't have to checkout till midday. And the bad 1. Your in a box room about 8 meters by 8 meters (and the bathroom 6m by 6m)but your never going to be in it much, its good enough for sleeping. 2. The breakfast is rubbish i wouldn't bother if u have the chance to opt out. There are plenty of bars serving full english breakfasts or whatever u want for 3 euros.The hotel breakfast consists of cornflakes, bread, coissant and bun, jams and butter and tea coffee or hot chocolate...and thats it! 3. Your room can either have No view or be Noisy...if u have a room at the back u look directly onto another set of rooms in a square 1m by 1meter, if u have a room on the front its damn noisy! I'd recommend going for the back room and not bothering with a view.Also the rooms don't have much natural light. 4. The walls are thin and u can hear people walking round. Recommendation , take some ear plugs they do the job perfectly. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to go and see Barcelona we spent 6nights at this hotel,we just slept in it and that was it.
